title: Expert Modeling vs. Self-Directed Modeling: Comparative Education on Mathematical Problem-Solving Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Systematic comparative analysis of expert thinking process modeling and self-directed model development in mathematical problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the characteristics of Expert Modeling (EM) and Self-Guided Modeling (SGM).
Learners can compare the efficiency of the two modeling techniques in intermediate-level mathematical problem-solving with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can select and apply modeling strategies appropriate to their level of expertise.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
